metadata.title: Tuesday, 21st March, 2023
metadata.session: SECOND SESSION OF THE THIRTEENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) when the construction of Mulema Sampa Health Post in Malole Parliamentary Constituency will be completed;
(b) what the cause of the delay in completing the project is; and
(c) what the time frame for the completion of the outstanding works is.

questions.minister: Minister of Water Development and Sanitation
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to construct a water reticulation plant in Chembe District;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Home Affairs and Internal Security
parts: (a) when construction of the following infrastructure in Lusangazi District will commence;
(i) a police station; and (ii) staff houses;
(b) what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(c) what the estimated time frame for the completion of the project is.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to upgrade Chiwanda Primary School in Isoka District to a secondary school;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to electrify the following Schools in Mkaika Parliamentary Constituency:
(i) Chimtende; (ii) Chinkaombe; (iii) Mzime; and (iv) Lukweta; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to connect the following health facilities in Kasenengwa District to the national electricity grid:
(i) Chipembaulo Mini Hospital; (ii) Luona Mini Hospital; (iii) Kasenengwa Clinic; and (iv) Chizenje Clinic; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to construct communication towers in the following Wards in Milanzi Parliamentary Constituency:

(i) Kapoche;                                                                                                            (iv) Kamphambe; and (ii) Kafumbwe;                                                                                                         (v) Chindwale; (iii) Katiula;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER (STANDING ORDER 75) W6. Mr. Nyambose (Chasefu) - to ask the Minister of Local Government and Rural Development:
(a) how much money the Government has been releasing as Local Government Equalisation Fund since inception, to each council;
(b) whether the councils have been using the 20% capital component of the Fund as intended;
(c) whether the utilisation of the capital component of the Fund has yielded the intended results;
(d) if not, what measures the Government is taking to ensure that the 20% capital component is utilisedas intended;
(e) which three councils performed well in terms of applying the 20% component of the Fund from 2019 to 2021; and
(f) which three councils performed the least. W7. Mr. Chanda (Kanchibiya) - to ask the Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development:
(a) when construction of the Mpika - Munikashi road in Kanchibiya Parliamentary Constituency will commence;
(b) what the cause of the delay in commencing the project is;
(c) what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(d) what the estimated time frame for the completion of the project is. W8. Mr. Mtayachalo (Chama North) - to ask the Minister of Mines and Minerals Development:
(a) when the exploration for oil and gas was last conducted in Chama District;
(b) what the results of the exploration were;
(c) whether the Government has any plans to conduct further oil and gas explorations in the District;
(d) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and

(e) if there are no such plans, why. PRESENTATION OF GOVERNMENT BILL The Minister of Green Economy and Environment The Environmental Management (Amendment) – Bill to amend the Environmental Management Act, 2011.  (N.A.B 6/2023)
